predictions.text: U.S. Unemployment Rate (U-3, seasonally adjusted) for November 2025 will print between 3.8% and 4.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify using the BLS Employment Situation news release for November 2025; accept the headline unemployment rate (Table A-1) as the official value.
monitoring_signals: Weekly initial and continuing jobless claims trends
Household survey employment and labor force participation rate
Challenger job-cut announcements
NFIB hiring plans and ISM employment subindices
predictions.rationale: Labor market is cooling gradually but remains resilient; claims and hiring surveys suggest a tight but easing jobs market.

predictions.text: U.S. CPI (headline, YoY, NSA) for November 2025 will print between 3.0% and 3.4%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm from the BLS CPI news release for November 2025; use the all-items CPI year-over-year percent change (NSA) as published.
monitoring_signals: Gasoline and energy price trends (EIA weekly retail, crude futures)
Used car auction prices (Manheim Index)
Rents and OER measures in private datasets
Food commodity price indices
predictions.rationale: Disinflation trend persists; energy volatility and steady services inflation likely keep YoY near low-3%.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing Employment Index for November 2025 will print between 47.5 and 50.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Use the Institute for Supply Management’s official November 2025 report; verify the Employment Index value.
monitoring_signals: Regional Fed manufacturing employment components
S&P Global Manufacturing employment subindex
Jobless claims in manufacturing-heavy states
Auto production schedules and aerospace order books
predictions.rationale: Factory hiring remains soft amid subdued output, but layoffs are limited; employment likely hovers near contraction/neutral.

predictions.text: S&P Global US Manufacturing PMI Final (headline) for November 2025 will print between 51.0 and 52.3.
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm from S&P Global’s US Manufacturing PMI Final November 2025 report; use the headline seasonally adjusted index.
monitoring_signals: Flash PMI reading and revisions history
Export orders and new orders components
Supplier delivery times and input cost indices
Dollar index (DXY) and global demand indicators
predictions.rationale: Flash readings suggest modest expansion; final prints typically see small revisions.

predictions.text: UK Monthly GDP (October 2025, m/m, seasonally adjusted) will print between -0.2% and +0.2%.
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify via the ONS GDP monthly estimate release; use the month-over-month growth rate for October 2025.
monitoring_signals: UK PMI output indices (manufacturing/services)
Retail sales volumes and card spending
Industrial production and construction output
Energy usage/weather-related effects
predictions.rationale: Activity remains near flat amid weak manufacturing and cautious consumers; services provide some offset.

predictions.text: OFAC will announce at least one Venezuela-related sanctions designation by 2025-12-31 (UTC) via a U.S. Treasury press release.
predictions.verification_criteria: Check U.S. Treasury press releases for a sanctions action explicitly referencing Venezuela (country program or targets) dated on/before 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: U.S.–Venezuela diplomatic statements and deadlines
Elections, opposition negotiations, and human rights reports
Oil sector developments and sanctions waivers
Allied actions (EU, UK sanctions) and coordination
predictions.rationale: Escalating U.S. pressure and evolving aviation/energy restrictions increase probability of year-end sanctions activity.

predictions.text: OpenAI will publish an official blog post or press release announcing the introduction of advertisements in ChatGPT for general users by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify by presence of an OpenAI blog or press post explicitly announcing ads in ChatGPT, dated on/before 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Internal app UI tests or ad placeholders discovered
Partner advertiser announcements
OpenAI policy and product update posts
SDK/API billing or feature changes tied to ads
predictions.rationale: Leaked plans and monetization pressures suggest imminent formalization of an ad-supported model.

predictions.text: COMEX Silver front-month futures will settle at or above $32.00 per troy ounce on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Confirm using CME Group official settlement prices for the most-active (front-month) Silver (SI) futures contract on/before 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: DXY and U.S. real yields (TIPS)
Solar PV demand and electronics sector indicators
ETF flows (e.g., SLV) and CFTC positioning
Gold price momentum and risk sentiment
predictions.rationale: Tight physical markets, strong solar demand, and supportive macro (stable USD/real yields) make a spike plausible.

predictions.text: ICE Endex TTF front-month natural gas will settle at or above €50.00/MWh on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Use ICE Endex official settlement prices for the TTF front-month contract on/before 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: European weather forecasts (HDDs) and cold snaps
LNG supply disruptions and Norwegian pipeline flows
Storage levels vs. 5-year averages
Geopolitical risks affecting energy logistics
predictions.rationale: Winter demand, potential LNG/flow outages, and geopolitics could trigger a temporary price spike.

predictions.text: The U.S. 2-Year Treasury yield (FRED: DGS2) will close at or below 4.25% on at least one trading day by 2025-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verify with FRED series DGS2 daily close at or below 4.25% on any trading day through 2025-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Core PCE/CPI prints and inflation expectations
Employment data surprises (NFP, jobless claims)
FOMC communications and dot-plot expectations
Financial conditions index and term premium moves
predictions.rationale: Softening inflation and growth data could pull forward cut expectations, nudging 2-year yields lower temporarily.
